course.subject: HART
course.name: Arts and Creativity
course.description: An experiential learning course designed to engage students in exploring arts and their own creative abilities through a series of lectures/seminars on arts and creativity, art tutorials and enrichment activities. Students will have the opportunities to create their own artwork and learn through guided reflective activities individually as well as in groups.

reviews.author: Dgehsjdhf
reviews.comment_content: Basically a drawing class supported by different creative theories.  Don't attend if you hate creating or drawing. Required to produce an art essay on any topic that interests you + final project in free format + portfolio (which is basically a summary of what you did in class, no extra effort needed). Include some guest lecture which aimed mainly to inspired-not academically related.
reviews.comment_teaching: A very relaxed classroom, where students are sitting in groups. Can chat and eat a bit during the creative process. The prof is very openminded and talkative and passionate.
reviews.comment_grading: Decent. As long as you attend the class, it won't be so bad. Not so heavy emphasis on drawing skills.  Can do an optional art visit report to gain extra marks. 80% attendance needed.
reviews.comment_workload: It's okay. Before the mid-term period basically nothing to do. Leave some time for the 5-8 page essay (including pictures) and a final project. No revision needed.

reviews.author: sww
reviews.comment_content:
教你如何generate一d creative idea去創作／畫畫
內容唔悶，如果鐘意畫畫會幾enjoy
唯一痛苦位係要係短時間內諗到creative idea畫畫，諗唔到都幾焦慮，因為好驚堂尾被抽中share作品
reviews.comment_teaching:
因為係online class，上堂唔算太多同其他人交流機會，但feel到佢已經儘量製造多d 互動，上堂開頭會講下書咁，之後個幾鐘都係畫畫，然後最尾十五分鐘會叫人share自己作品，唔夠時間無share到就要send email比佢，佢會比comment你
online class都算係咁，不過如果係face to face有得同其他人一齊傾下計畫下畫相信會更加開心
reviews.comment_grading:
幾好grade，feel到佢比分比得算generous，2 cred HART course可以當輕鬆下又可以拉到grade，讀得過

- Written Essay (20%)：都幾莫名其妙的一份assignment，要寫關於對creativity的睇法或者介紹一d特別藝術品，5-8 pages
- Individual artwork + presentation (40%)：完全no topic，自由發揮
- Attendance, Overall performance (20%)
- Learning portfolio (10%)：平時上堂畫既畫group埋一齊
- Extra Activity (10%)：可有可無lol其實，寫500字關於你參加的virtual gallery／art activity

感覺written essay同extra activity同上堂學既野無咩關係
本身有畫開畫的確係易d好grade，不過都要睇你比幾多心機落去

individual artwork 5/5
written essay 4/5
portfolio 4.5/5
extra activity 4/5

Final grade：A
reviews.comment_workload: HART course workload一向都重，要開心又靚grade的代價，但呢個course最辛苦係佢所有deadline都係sem尾同一日一次過交曬4份assignment，講緊係一幅A3畫／其他形式作品，一份5-8 pages essay，一份十幾二十版portfolio加comment，500字review，唔好忘記sem尾仲有其他course既deadline，如果想好grade有quality就要提前半個月開始做，除此之外sem頭sem中都係零workload很輕鬆的～

reviews.author: 1chunat
reviews.comment_content:
- 主要教構思創意作品的方法
- 相對少教畫畫技巧

1. Lecture: Introduction to Creativity Creativity in Art and Design
2. Developing Ideational Fluency
3. Sources of Creative Stimulation: Collections
4. Sources of Creative Stimulation: Synesthesia
5. An introduction to Wicked Problems vs. Tame Problems
6. The Spaces of Meaning
7. STORYTELLING: Fictioning and Futuring
8. 2 Guest Lectures
reviews.comment_teaching:
- 一星期2堂 (1 tutorial, 1 lecture)
- 每堂都有Artwork要做
- Brian 很著重作品的創意，對畫畫技巧的要求不高，但其實呈現一定創意也需要一定技巧
- Brian 會覆email，有問題都會回答
reviews.comment_grading:
- Written Essay (20%)
- Individual artwork + presentation (40%)
- Attendance, Overall performance (20%)
- Learning portfolio (10%)
- Extra Activity (10%)
* Tutorial 畫的作品全部都要交，Brian 會根據你的進步給分
* Extra Activity, Written Essay都沒有明確的指引，Brian 的要求的創意
reviews.comment_workload:
- 以一個2 Cred Course 來說，要做的Assignment 算多
- 唯沒有MT及Final
- 計Attendance

reviews.author: datboi
reviews.title: A fun, relaxing, no-stress course. But time consuming
reviews.comment_content:
The instructor was Benny Lau.

This course does not introduce you to artistic skills such as painting or sketching, and does not really cover any fundamental concepts in art. Instead it is more of a "creativity" class than "ar`t". However the course really doesn't really teach you to be creative, so its better if you are already kind of creative or passionate about arts.

Despite the mediocre content, I had alot of fun in this course, perhaps the most fun I've had in UST. The weekly assignments were really interesting and original, they feel like a breath of fresh air. The project was also really fun, Benny gives alot of supportive input and is encouraging, although I spent a really long time on the artwork, it felt really rewarding to complete.



Course content:
(1) Arts and creativity
(2) Convergent and divergent thinking
(3) Free association and forced association
(4) Ways of seeing
(5) Medium
(6) Synesthesia
(7) Collection
(8) Design thinking
(9) Critical thinking
(10) Fictioning
reviews.comment_teaching:
Benny's teaching kind of sucks.
The course actually contains many interesting concepts in its curriculum / learning objectives, but the content Benny teaches is really brief and minimal.

In the first three tutorials, we would have some practical exercises like some paper origami, paper cutting and tissue paper sculptures. They were really fun and I actually was looking forward for the next sessions.
But it seems that after the three tutorials, Benny just gave up, and after that we just spent all the tutorial discussing each other's homework assignments, which was stupidly boring and waste of time.

Attendance is taken for both tutorial and lecture. So you cant even skip them.
reviews.comment_grading:
Honestly the grading was kind of BS - I legit nearly got full marks for all grading criteria and still only got an A  (no one got A+ in class btw). I know I sound really ungrateful, but holy shit I actually went super tryhard for assignments, project, essay and class participation. Even after few months I am still really butthurt about this. sorry :(

I guess everything is subjective. So just hope Benny likes you and your artwork, or kiss his ass more to get a better grade. :)

Grading:
Individual Artwork (50%)
Learning Portfolio (10%) - (Weekly homework)
Written Essay (20%)
Critique (20%)
reviews.comment_workload:
There assignments every week. The assignments were pretty simple, they take like 1-2 hours to complete.

But you'll have to prepare a final artwork to present to your class. The theme for the project was "Machines", you'll have to interpret the theme in your own way and provoke ideas / statements through your work. You will have to present your work to your class at the end, and there will be a Q&A session afterwards for each students.
The project is definitely be what spent most of my time on. You have to plan your ideas and present it to the class for discussion and input, and that will guide the scope / idea of your project. Make sure to email or talk to Benny (or your instructor) about your main idea for their input since they are the one marking.
** Don't be too constricted by the theme, since you are apparently supposed to "think outside the box" or be creative. Benny actually encouraged us to be more metaphorical. (Basically just BS your way through lol)

There is a 500-800 word essay about anything you've experienced throughout the course (artist, style, medium, artworks, concepts etc) that influenced your artwork. This part is pretty simple. Personally I chose to just write about an artist + concept which influenced my work.

And finally there is the critique. It is just a 200-300 word long response to any 2 artwork by your peers. Probably the simplest part of the course lol. We write this after the presentations / Q&A, so its really easy :P


There is actually a fair amount of work, but most of it is really chill and relaxing imo.
Assignments + project were kind of fun and there wasn't too much written work, so I didn't really feel burdened by this course.

reviews.author: hohoho123
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content: There's a lot of drawing techniques u will have to learn. But its nothing hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaches basic stuff about drawing techniques. Easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: He keeps on saying that the grading is based on how our work is boring or not. Didn't try hard to be creative with my work but still got a B. Not bad.
reviews.comment_workload: U will have to participate to almost every class becuz u have different drawings to draw every class and u also have to attend one extra activity (museum, gallery, etc.) and write short summary about the experience. Also you have to create your own project/drawing for the final. And write an essay about anything you want (only for the final). If you enjoy drawing and actually participate enthusiastically, it's no problem. I enjoyed it :)

reviews.author: diornasa
reviews.comment_content: You learn about different drawing techniques and how to come up with ideas of what to draw (brainstorming etc.). lots of the work done in class is in groups. Doesn't really cover much about the written coursework in class but its very self explanatory and you can go to him if you need advice/questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Super chill teacher, basically just gives a quick brief of what you're gonna do before each lecture then lets you get on with your work. If you have any questions you can just ask him. No specific slides/materials that you need to learn. The written coursework is pretty straight forward to do on your own.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very lenient on grading, I suggest taking this course if you want an easy A/B! I was the worst in the class as I had never done anything art related in school and only did drawing/colouring for fun. Managed to get an A-.  

Portfolio of 10 drawings - best drawings done over the course to submit
Written essay on a specific artist - pic an artist and analyse some of their work
Written essay on an art exhibition you visited - visit an art exhibition in HK, take photos of the work and talk about the artist and background of the pieces
Attendance - can only miss 4 lectures
Final drawing - a final piece of work with a written essay to explain what it's about
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not much until the final 2 weeks when everything is due. You mainly do all your drawing in class each week so there's no HWK unless he asks you to bring in something (very rare).

reviews.author: Vvickieeeeee
reviews.title: relaxing class
reviews.comment_content:
basically it is a really relaxing class
the teacher also gave us quite a lot of freedom on what to draw and what to do
you don't have to be afraid to express your art as the teacher wouldn't judge your content, he wants mind blowing stuff and creativity.
(for example, my booklet was filled with idol and guys ahahahaaha, the teacher didnt complain tho)
reviews.comment_teaching: he gave us a lot of freedom and the students get along well
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A- in the end, which is quite satisfactory as i'm very annoying during class hehe
reviews.comment_workload: well personally i love art and stuff so it is not a lot of workload for me as i often draw

reviews.author: poopooball
reviews.comment_content: It is basically a drawing class with two guest lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brian is a interesting and talkative teacher. You can learn a lot if you ask him any questions as he is always willing to teach extra.
reviews.comment_grading: I hand in my work on time(p.s. I did not spend much time but I still got a B+). Fair grading.
reviews.comment_workload: The only thing to do in class is drawing so the workload is small as you can finish it in class normally. Before the end of the semester you have to hand in essays and final project.

reviews.author: soy
reviews.title: Very very extremely free classes but hard-working people will learn more
reviews.comment_content:
(唔想睇英文geh 下面有Google translate 中文版)

Drawing and mind-blowing classes.
Very free as long as you are drawing in class.

He will first teach you how to use some simple drawing materials including pastel, charcoal, chalk, color pencil...

Then, he will teach you how to think of new ideas or creative ideas.

只需繪畫同mind-blowing的課堂。
只要您在課堂上繪畫，非常free。

他將首先教您如何使用一些簡單的繪畫材料，包括粉彩，木炭，粉筆，彩色鉛筆...

然後，他將教您如何思考新想法或創意技巧。
reviews.comment_teaching:
(唔想睇英文geh 下面有Google translate 中文版)

You will have to ask more and listen more when he come to your table. It is completely different from normal lecturing classes.

當他來到您的桌子旁時，您將不得不問更多些並多聽些。 同正常的講課完全唔同。
reviews.comment_grading:
I got an A- which is not quite satisfying consider the 2 weeks I spent to work on the final submissions (mentioned in "WORKLOAD") and all the time in class paying efforts.

考慮到我花了2個星期的時間來完成最後的提交（在“WORKLOAD”中提到），並且一直在課堂上付出geh努力，我得到了A- geh成績並不令人滿意。
reviews.comment_workload:
You only have to draw in class.

But You'd better start earlier to do the following assignments:
At the end of the semester, you will have to hand in a few things, including
1. your drawing book's digital copy,
2. a short essay,
3. a very short exhibition review.

在課堂上，您只需要繪畫。

（但是您最好早些開始做以下工作。）
在學期末，您需要提交
1. 畫簿 digital copy,
2. 簡短的論文,
3. 非常簡短的展覽回顧。

reviews.author: jello
reviews.comment_content: The course is about training your brain to be more creative. It is actually quite interesting and fun. Marketing student might find it quite useful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teachers were from poluU as I remember. It could be very boring when they were showing a lot of art work in the powerpoint. However, it was quite relaxing when it comes to group activities. you might have to share your thoughts to the whole class in nearly every lesson but it was very casual. The class size is very small so you can easily be friends with others normally.
p.s. quite a lot of foreigners and exchange students took this course at that time
reviews.comment_grading:
I got an A at last so I think the marking isn't very strict because I skipped class for a few times.
just be brave at class to speak out your thoughts and be creative will be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload can be quite heavy though. you will have to hand in a lablog (sketchbook) at the end of the course. However, if you go to every lesson you basically don't need to do anything extra because most of the inclass activity is basically doing your lablog. Do remember to keep everything (notes/ photo) in lesson!! I think you can get a higher mark if your lablog is creative and  informative.

reviews.author: Joie
reviews.title: First Class Impressions
reviews.comment_content: Content is interesting because they teach you about creativity, but there was no indication that the only "art" portion we'd learn about was film.
reviews.comment_teaching: I thought it'd be more interactive since it is an art class but the title is misleading because it seems to be lots of powerpoint lectures and lab book work on your own time. The lecturers are dry. They try to get the small class to participate but the same people half-heartedly volunteer.
reviews.comment_grading: It's arts and creativity - they can't claim that you're not being creative or your work isn't artsy enough.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload for the "creativity" side consists of a lablog (40%) and class attendance/participation (10%). Workload for the "arts" side consists of a short essay - 10%/film preparation - 5%/group film - 25% surrounding a theme (ours was "First love is...").
Manageable, but there are lots of lablogs.
